author: cmpilato
msg: Switch to filesystem over to a streamy write interface.  That is, no
longer are the entire new contents of a file held in memory during the
use of the stream returned by svn_fs_apply_textdelta().
This change, while it does modify some internal representations of
data used in our Berkeley database storage, is design to be compatible
Also, changed this function to return a writable stream on a new
EDIT-DATA-KEY, rather than simply writing the contents of a
Also, changed this function to return a writable stream on a new
EDIT-DATA-KEY, rather than simply writing the contents of a
(svn_fs_apply_textdelta): Switch this to a trail-sy operation, and
implement streamy writes under the hood.
Made consistent the descriptions of file and directory node revision
HEADERs, and added optional EDIT-DATA-KEY for files.
(is_valid_node_revision): Become aware of EDIT-DATA-KEY reps, too.

msg: Added 'Is Subversion stable enough for me to use for my own projects?' FAQ

author: dws
msg: * packages/rpm/subversion.spec, expat.patch : Fixed up subversion.spec and
expat patch to use a sed script to change libexpat to -lexpat so I don't
have to keep making changes to the expat.patch every time someone changes
